name: Pacer

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Not bad. You're lucky I was drawing their fire, otherwise you would have been chewed up.

topics.topic_text: VFSGuardPacerMocksGloria
topics.response_text: Actually, I've got a better idea. Make the new hire tell her. You'll do that for me, won't you?

topics.topic_text: VFSPacerBetrays
topics.response_text: And you. Bringing these assholes in here like you're doing us some kind of favor.

topics.topic_text: Who's the King?
topics.response_text: Who's the King? You believe this asshole, man?

topics.topic_text: Yes, I'd like to see the King if possible.
topics.response_text: Anything's possible, I suppose. How much is it worth to you to meet the big man?

topics.topic_text: Goodbye.
topics.response_text: Whatever.

topics.topic_text: Here's 5 caps.
topics.response_text: What, do I look like a beggar to you? Take a hike, cheapskate.

topics.topic_text: Here's 50 caps.
topics.response_text: You know what? I think you and the King have some business to discuss.

topics.topic_text: Is 500 caps enough?
topics.response_text: Whoa. I mean, yeah, that should do. The King will see you now.

topics.topic_text: Maybe I should be going.
topics.response_text: Sounds about right.

topics.topic_text: What about you?
topics.response_text: They seem to have it in for me. Go figure. While they waste all their bullets trying to get me, you head in and waste 'em.

topics.topic_text: What do you want me to do?
topics.response_text: Take these assholes out, what else? Now go!

topics.topic_text: What's my help worth to you?
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] You're a bastard after my own heart. Here, it's all I got.

topics.topic_text: I don't have much on me.
topics.response_text: Then the King has no interest in seeing you.

topics.topic_text: I'm new in town, and wanted to pay my respects.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] You know what? I like you. Half of the people around here, they forget who runs this place.

topics.topic_text: Pacer, I won't let you ruin this opportunity.
topics.response_text: Let's see you stop me, then. Guys, let's teach these soldier boys a lesson.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about Freeside.
topics.response_text: It ain't much to look at, but this dump has something that even the Strip doesn't, and that's absolute freedom.

topics.topic_text: I think that's up to the King.
topics.response_text: Not anymore it isn't. He's not in his right mind if he's even thinking about making a deal with this scum.

topics.topic_text: I was afraid this would happen. Sergeant, you know what to do.
topics.response_text: What the f-? Get the others! Now!

topics.topic_text: So you'll fight him *and* the NCR? Can the Kings afford to fight each other?
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] I... No. We would never survive. We need to stick together.

topics.topic_text: What can you tell me about the Kings?
topics.response_text: Not much to tell. We're a bunch of guys that just want to do our own thing, and anyone who's got a problem with that can shove it.

topics.topic_text: How did you join the Kings?
topics.response_text: I didn't join the Kings. I helped start the Kings. This whole operation you see here was put together by the King and yours truly.

topics.topic_text: I'm trying to get to the Strip. Know anything that could help me out?
topics.response_text: You're looking to get past those tin cans at the gate, right? They let people by all the time, if they've got the caps.

topics.topic_text: We're dealing with the King, not you.
topics.response_text: You're going to have to deal with me whether you like it or not. Get them!

topics.topic_text: Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: Sure.

topics.topic_text: What about crime?
topics.response_text: What about it? Someone takes your stuff, you're free to take it back. If you can't, maybe you shouldn't have come to Freeside in the first place.

topics.topic_text: Don't the Kings run this place, though?
topics.response_text: We do what we want, just like everybody else. We just have more guys, so other people tend to do what we want, too.

topics.topic_text: I heard a rumor that there's something between you and the Van Graffs. What happened?
topics.response_text: Pfff, that's old news. I had some fun with that girl that runs their operation, and then I got tired of her. So I moved on.

topics.topic_text: Is there anyone like that in Freeside?
topics.response_text: Well, the Van Graffs for one. We had a slight difference of opinion when they first showed up.

topics.topic_text: So there's no law here at all?
topics.response_text: People can do whatever they want, they just have to keep in mind what'll happen afterward.

topics.topic_text: What is there to do in Freeside?
topics.response_text: Aside from this place, there's the Atomic Wrangler just up the street. Women, gambling, booze, you name it, they got you covered.

topics.topic_text: Did you have something to do with that NCR messenger getting attacked?
topics.response_text: Look, I already told you that was bullshit. Probably just an excuse those lying soldier scum made up to not share their grub with us.

topics.topic_text: VMS19PacerIntercedes
topics.response_text: Hey there, I heard that NCR soldier lady told you some wild story about them sending a messenger to us to work out some deal.

topics.topic_text: What's my silence worth to you?
topics.response_text: You're a bastard after my own heart. Here, this should do it.

topics.topic_text: That's a good start...
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] Fine, here's some more, but you better keep you mouth shut! I'm out of here. Got some important business to take care of.

topics.topic_text: Thanks. I suddenly forgot what I was going to tell the King.
topics.response_text: Good, see that it stays that way. Now if you'll pardon me, I got some important business to take care of.

topics.topic_text: I still think he should know about it.
topics.response_text: That's a shame. Well, do what you want. Just don't expect it to matter.

topics.topic_text: You're right. He shouldn't be bothered with rumors right now.
topics.response_text: Exactly. Seeing that we're of one mind on this, I'll head out. I got business to take care of.

topics.topic_text: Thanks. This will keep me warm while I tell the story to the King.
topics.response_text: Why you lit- You're just lucky I got something important to take care of. We'll settle this later.

topics.topic_text: I'll be sure to pass it along.
topics.response_text: That's a good dog. Well, I'm out of here. Later, Simon.

topics.topic_text: Why not tell her yourself?
topics.response_text: I would, but I tend to distract the boss lady a little too much. She can't help herself.

topics.topic_text: Get out of here before you get hurt.
topics.response_text: Ouch, this one's got a bite, Simon! Call him off, or he'll get put down.

topics.topic_text: Care to back that up?
topics.response_text: Let's take this chump, guys!

topics.topic_text: Good to see you, too, Pacer.
topics.response_text: I'm sure it's the highlight of your day. Anyway, I've gotta bounce. Things to do, and all that.

topics.topic_text: Why don't you just get the hell out of here?
topics.response_text: Who do you think you're talking to? Just because the King happens to like you, doesn't mean you can run your mouth any way you damn like.

topics.topic_text: Apparently I do. Something wrong with that?
topics.response_text: No, nothing wrong at all. By all means, carry on.

topics.topic_text: Actually, it does. What are you going to do about it?
topics.response_text: You asked for it, punk!

topics.topic_text: Never mind. Just forget I said anything.
topics.response_text: Yeah, that's what I thought.

topics.topic_text: Do you ever stop talking tough?
topics.response_text: Yeah, right before I beat somebody down. Let's take this fool, boys.

topics.topic_text: Nah, I've just risen up in the world.
topics.response_text: Ha, you've got yourself a live one here, Simon. Anyway, I've got things to do. Later.

topics.topic_text: Work is work, right?
topics.response_text: Spoken like a chump. A King doesn't have to grovel before others to get paid. Anyway, I've got better things to do than shoot the shit with you.

conversation.response_text: I've got a few guys already waiting to go.
Hey, Simon. How's it hanging? Looks like you've got a little helper today.
This is bullshit! Why are we even talking about dealing with these guys?

description:
Pacer is a 28 year-old Caucasian Male.

Pacer is the abrasive right-hand man of The King, leader of The Kings gang in Freeside. He can typically be found at the King's School of Impersonation, where he manages the gang's affairs and serves as The King's most trusted advisor. Despite his position, Pacer struggles with a Jet addiction and a weak heart, which are well-documented in his medical records at the Old Mormon Fort.

Pacer's Personality: Pacer is fiercely loyal to The King but is generally abrasive and suspicious toward outsiders, particularly the Courier. He is quick-tempered and pragmatic, willing to use intimidation and violence to protect The King and the interests of The Kings. Despite his tough exterior, his Jet addiction has left him physically vulnerable and dependent on the drug to function.

Pacer's Backstory: Pacer grew up in the harsh streets of Freeside and rose through the ranks of The Kings through his unwavering loyalty and willingness to do whatever The King asked of him. He became The King's right-hand man after proving his loyalty during a particularly dangerous conflict with rival gangs. Over time, the stress of his position led him to turn to Jet as a coping mechanism, a habit that has now become a full-blown addiction. Despite knowing the damage it's doing to his already weak heart, Pacer continues to use Jet to maintain the energy and aggression needed to protect The King.
